page.title: 05Tourism Consiton/Swine
page.content: Because the min A165 Hull- Bridlington road by-passes Coniston few tourists are attracted to its rural charm. However those who do make the detour will find a visit to its neighbour, Swine worthhile. Swine is about one mile west of Coniston along a minor backroad. The main attraction here is the church with its 12th century nave which was originally the chancel of a Cistercian church established in 1150. The beautiful 16th centry screen, with its Davey, Hilton, Melton and Lascelles family badges, separates the north aisle from the Hilton knights in 14th century armour, two of whom lie alongside their ladies. Other groups provide swine with the finest set of village church effigies in the East Riding. The quaintly humerous misericords underneath the choir-stall are well worth inspecting.
